item.title: changing *that* keyboard shortcut right there (in gnome)
item.description: I love my keyboard shortcuts, and I sometimes I want to change them. If you’re ever in a gnome application and wanted to change that one right there, you can now live-edit them! In a terminal, first enable this feature: gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface can-change-accels true Next, hover over the menu item shortcut that you want to change. Enter the shortcut you want. It should update immediately! I like to disable this live-editing, so that I don’t accidentally change any shortcuts.
